text:
This blog is intended to create awareness of environmental topics that can be relevant to various fields such as ecology, psychology, data science, etc.
Topics in this blog include, recycling, ecopsychology, and water pollution.

In order to successfully illustrate such topics and their related fields, you must know how to follow the steps below:

Web Development: Utilizing Quarto To Create A Website

Step 1: Download Quarto
Download it here:


Step 2: Create a New Project in RStudio

Click “Create a Project” in the top left corner
Click “New Directory”
Choose either “Quarto Website” or “Quarto Blog”
Check the box to create a Git Repository

If it does not initially create a repository, you may have to type this into the console to link your GitHub account and create a repository:
usethis::use_github()




Step 3: What’s Next?
Now that you have a website created, there are a few more steps that must be taken.

title: Eco-Anxiety
text:
This is an image of people interacting with Mother Nature.


Eco-anxiety is a widely new term that is being used to describe the worry that people feel after hearing of environmental tragedies. This worry can often lead to panic attacks, sleeplessness, loss of appetite, and many more symptoms of anxiety. Before becoming aware of the science of how we have gotten to where we are, I would say I suffered from eco-anxiety. Now that I have learned further about the causes of many environmental tragedies, I have learned to accept and adapt to the changes in the environment. Although a single person cannot reverse climate change, I would say, doing my part to prevent further damage, has been fulfilling. I would encourage you all to do your research and take some action by using less water, avoiding single-use plastics, saving energy, and much more. While doing so, please inspire your friends and family to do their part as well.

title: Files
text:
What does each file mean?

_quarto.yml
This codes for the website as a whole, establishing overarching characteristics, such as the theme of the website.


index.qmd
This file codes for the home page of the website, allowing you to include graphics and text related to your website’s theme.


posts
This folder contains files that contain the individual folders, files, and pictures for our blog posts. Our blog posts focus on the environment and awareness of environmental topics that face our planet today.

index.qmd
The posts file has individual folders that each contain an index file and any images included in the post. Each file codes for individual blog post pages.

title: YML
text:
What is a YML File?
The YML file codes for overall characteristics of the website. This includes the title, navigation bar, banners, cookies, and the format.

Under “Format” you can pick the theme of your website. This provides a useful tool that aids in the communication of data science topics. By choosing a theme that aligns with your topic, you can further visualize your purpose.
You can add a banner to your website of an image that aligns with your theme. We chose to include an image of the clash between construction and nature to highlight the impacts of deforestation.
